title: Restore last working Dreamonomy site version after broken deployment

requirements.text: Rollback the frontend to the last known working step/version so the full DREAMONOMY marketing site renders again (Home, About/Why, Services, Contact) with the existing navigation, footer, and page layouts intact.

quotes: NO NO NO WHOLE SITE IS GONE GO BACK TO LAST STEP PLEASE

acceptanceCriteria: The deployed site loads successfully (no blank screen) and renders the Navbar + Footer and a page body on initial load.
All primary routes/pages (Home, About/Why, Services, Contact) are reachable via the existing navigation and render content.
No console errors prevent rendering (no uncaught runtime exceptions on page load).

requirements.text: Identify and revert the specific change(s) introduced in the latest deployment that caused the site to disappear/break (e.g., routing/rendering logic, missing component export/import, CSS that hides the app root), and ensure the project builds and deploys successfully again.
acceptanceCriteria: Frontend build completes successfully without errors.
The root React app mounts and displays visible content above the fold on desktop and mobile viewport sizes.
Hash-based navigation in the existing app shell works again (switching pages does not produce a blank screen).

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only).
Do not edit immutable hook/bootstrap paths: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx.
Keep the site fully static with no required backend functionality or server dependencies.
nonGoals: Do not introduce new features or new pages as part of the rollback.
Do not change DREAMONOMY copy/content beyond what is necessary to restore the last working state.
Do not add or change authentication or backend logic.
